testcase.name: test_cli
testcase.system-err:
2023-11-22 03:45:19 80ac3eb7f7f2 humanfriendly.testing[22415] DEBUG Calling command line entry point with arguments: ['/workdir/humanfriendly-10.0/.tox/cpythonlibtest-unit-test-tests/bin/python'] 2023-11-22 03:45:19 80ac3eb7f7f2 humanfriendly.testing[22415] DEBUG Command line entry point returned successfully! 2023-11-22 03:45:19 80ac3eb7f7f2 humanfriendly.testing[22415] DEBUG Output on stdout:
Usage: humanfriendly [OPTIONS]
Human friendly input/output (text formatting) on the command line based on the Python package with the same name.
Supported options:
-c, --run-command
Execute an external command (given as the positional arguments) and render a spinner and timer while the command is running. The exit status of the command is propagated.
--format-table
Read tabular data from standard input (each line is a row and each whitespace separated field is a column), format the data as a table and print the resulting table to standard output. See also the --delimiter option.
-d, --delimiter=VALUE
Change the delimiter used by --format-table to VALUE (a string). By default all whitespace is treated as a delimiter.
-l, --format-length=LENGTH
Convert a length count (given as the integer or float LENGTH) into a human readable string and print that string to standard output.
-n, --format-number=VALUE
Format a number (given as the integer or floating point number VALUE) with thousands separators and two decimal places (if needed) and print the formatted number to standard output.
-s, --format-size=BYTES
Convert a byte count (given as the integer BYTES) into a human readable string and print that string to standard output.
-b, --binary
Change the output of -s, --format-size to use binary multiples of bytes (base-2) instead of the default decimal multiples of bytes (base-10).
-t, --format-timespan=SECONDS
Convert a number of seconds (given as the floating point number SECONDS) into a human readable timespan and print that string to standard output.
--parse-length=VALUE
Parse a human readable length (given as the string VALUE) and print the number of metres to standard output.
--parse-size=VALUE
Parse a human readable data size (given as the string VALUE) and print the number of bytes to standard output.
--demo
Demonstrate changing the style and color of the terminal font using ANSI escape sequences.
-h, --help
Show this message and exit.

-d, --delimiter=VALUE
Change the delimiter used by --format-table to VALUE (a string). By default all whitespace is treated as a delimiter.

Convert a length count (given as the integer or float LENGTH) into a human readable string and print that string to standard output.
-n, --format-number=VALUE
Format a number (given as the integer or floating point number VALUE) with thousands separators and two decimal places (if needed) and print the formatted number to standard output.
-s, --format-size=BYTES

-b, --binary

testcase.name: test_parse_usage_commas
testcase.system-err: 2023-11-22 03:45:21 80ac3eb7f7f2 humanfriendly.usage[22415] DEBUG Parsed introduction: ['Usage: my-fancy-app [OPTIONS]', 'Some introduction goes here.', 'Supported options:'] 2023-11-22 03:45:21 80ac3eb7f7f2 humanfriendly.usage[22415] DEBUG Parsed options: ['-f, --first-option', 'Explanation of first option.', '-s, --second-option=WITH,COMMA', "This should be a separate option's description.\n"]

testcase.name: test_parse_usage_simple
testcase.system-err: 2023-11-22 03:45:21 80ac3eb7f7f2 humanfriendly.usage[22415] DEBUG Parsed introduction: ['Usage: my-fancy-app [OPTIONS]', 'Boring description.', 'Supported options:'] 2023-11-22 03:45:21 80ac3eb7f7f2 humanfriendly.usage[22415] DEBUG Parsed options: ['-h, --help', 'Show this message and exit.\n']

testcase.name: test_parse_usage_tricky
testcase.system-err:
2023-11-22 03:45:21 80ac3eb7f7f2 humanfriendly.usage[22415] DEBUG Parsed introduction: ['Usage: my-fancy-app [OPTIONS]', "Here's the introduction to my-fancy-app. Some of the lines in the
introduction start with a command line option just to confuse the
parsing algorithm :-)", 'For example
--an-awesome-option
is still part of the introduction.', 'Supported options:'] 2023-11-22 03:45:21 80ac3eb7f7f2 humanfriendly.usage[22415] DEBUG Parsed options: ['-a, --an-awesome-option', 'Explanation why this is an awesome option.', '-b, --a-boring-option', 'Explanation why this is a boring option.
']

testcase.name: test_prompt_for_choice

testcase.name: test_sphinx_customizations
testcase.system-err:
2023-11-22 03:45:24 80ac3eb7f7f2 humanfriendly.usage[22415] DEBUG Parsed introduction: ['Usage: humanfriendly [OPTIONS]', 'Human friendly input/output (text formatting) on the command
line based on the Python package with the same name.', 'Supported options:'] 2023-11-22 03:45:24 80ac3eb7f7f2 humanfriendly.usage[22415] DEBUG Parsed options: ['-c, --run-command', 'Execute an external command (given as the positional arguments) and render
a spinner and timer while the command is running. The exit status of the
command is propagated.', '--format-table', 'Read tabular data from standard input (each line is a row and each
whitespace separated field is a column), format the data as a table and
print the resulting table to standard output. See also the --delimiter
option.', '-d, --delimiter=VALUE', 'Change the delimiter used by --format-table to VALUE (a string). By default
all whitespace is treated as a delimiter.', '-l, --format-length=LENGTH', 'Convert a length count (given as the integer or float LENGTH) into a human
readable string and print that string to standard output.', '-n, --format-number=VALUE', 'Format a number (given as the integer or floating point number VALUE) with
thousands separators and two decimal places (if needed) and print the
formatted number to standard output.', '-s, --format-size=BYTES', 'Convert a byte count (given as the integer BYTES) into a human readable
string and print that string to standard output.', '-b, --binary', 'Change the output of -s, --format-size to use binary multiples of bytes
(base-2) instead of the default decimal multiples of bytes (base-10).', '-t, --format-timespan=SECONDS', 'Convert a number of seconds (given as the floating point number SECONDS)
into a human readable timespan and print that string to standard output.', '--parse-length=VALUE', 'Parse a human readable length (given as the string VALUE) and print the
number of metres to standard output.', '--parse-size=VALUE', 'Parse a human readable data size (given as the string VALUE) and print the
number of bytes to standard output.', '--demo', 'Demonstrate changing the style and color of the terminal font using ANSI
escape sequences.', '-h, --help', 'Show this message and exit.'] 2023-11-22 03:45:24 80ac3eb7f7f2 humanfriendly.usage[22415] DEBUG Rendered output: ['**Usage:** `humanfriendly [OPTIONS]`', 'Human friendly input/output (text formatting) on the command
line based on the Python package with the same name.', '**Supported options:**', '.. csv-table::
 :header: Option, Description
 :widths: 30, 70
', ' "``-c``, ``--run-command``","Execute an external command (given as the positional arguments) and render
 a spinner and timer while the command is running. The exit status of the
 command is propagated."
 ``--format-table``,"Read tabular data from standard input (each line is a row and each
 whitespace separated field is a column), format the data as a table and
 print the resulting table to standard output. See also the ``--delimiter``
 option."
 "``-d``, ``--delimiter=VALUE``","Change the delimiter used by ``--format-table`` to ``VALUE`` (a string). By default
 all whitespace is treated as a delimiter."
 "``-l``, ``--format-length=LENGTH``","Convert a length count (given as the integer or float ``LENGTH``) into a human
 readable string and print that string to standard output."
 "``-n``, ``--format-number=VALUE``","Format a number (given as the integer or floating point number ``VALUE``) with
 thousands separators and two decimal places (if needed) and print the
 formatted number to standard output."
 "``-s``, ``--format-size=BYTES``","Convert a byte count (given as the integer ``BYTES``) into a human readable
 string and print that string to standard output."
 "``-b``, ``--binary``","Change the output of ``-s``, ``--format-size`` to use binary multiples of bytes
 (base-2) instead of the default decimal multiples of bytes (base-10)."
 "``-t``, ``--format-timespan=SECONDS``","Convert a number of seconds (given as the floating point number ``SECONDS``)
 into a human readable timespan and print that string to standard output."
 ``--parse-length=VALUE``,"Parse a human readable length (given as the string ``VALUE``) and print the
 number of metres to standard output."
 ``--parse-size=VALUE``,"Parse a human readable data size (given as the string ``VALUE``) and print the
 number of bytes to standard output."
 ``--demo``,"Demonstrate changing the style and color of the terminal font using ANSI
 escape sequences."
 "``-h``, ``--help``",Show this message and exit.']
